reviewText: I did not like the fact that we have only have 2 videos and are all about the professor's background and accolades and then the contents of the course are 10 long PDF lectures. I believe this course can be improved by implementing other type of resources such as videos to understand the topics better. Definitely not satisfied with the experience.
theirs something wrong with the exams it doesn't work what ever was the answer so because of that s why i didn't complete this course

I am surprised to see that Rutgers allowed this specialization to bear the Rutgers name.  This gentleman seems to have great history out in the world of procurement and sourcing, but that doesn't qualify him to teach.  The video quality is poor, the supporting course materials are just PDFs made from miscellaneous, unconnected blogs, websites and other courses, and I don't believe anything that was presented in this course or the following 2 courses in the specialization contained information beyond what I'm able to find within a generic web search.  To both Coursera and Rutgers - this one is extremely disappointing.

The course was very informative but I wish it had gone in to detail regarding spend management and also some of the steps to create a commodity/category strategy. You list the steps in the article but don't give a break down of each step and provide examples. The goal should be to create a Commodity/Category Strategy after completing this course but I think more detailed information is needed. Overall, a good overview of Procurement.
